story:
MOFT Carry Sleeve is transcending the traditional laptop sleeve with an innovative 4-in-1 design. It provides the safety and protection of a sleeve, the ergonomy of a laptop stand, the portability essentials of a storage bag, and a look that lets you commute in style.

There are already laptop sleeves out there. But most are either too bulky or lack room for extra accessories. That’s what we set out to do and re-invented it to a slim and compact carry sleeve with an invisible stand and storage. It adheres to the MOFT’s design philosophy ”Good product is invisible”

 

It’s a wise carry-on solution for short-distance commuting. From the office to the cafe to school, MOFT keeps your day-to-day adventures light and convenient.

 

 


Designed by exclusive structure, the MOFT Carry Sleeve can be folded up to a stand in literally one second. With your laptop screen raised to a higher level, you will naturally sit straighter and negate physical stress. 

With MOFT carry sleeve, you don’t need to carry an extra laptop stand around with you - it’s already there, making your work life healthier without anything extra.

We designed MOFT sleeve to have two angles -  15° and 25°. Now, browsing through files and documents or having online meetings will be much more comfortable when your laptop is placed on the stand in 25° angles, which is the highest angles among the sleeves. And if you work at a higher desk? The 15° is ideal for an improved, strain-free view.

 


We all know that there are always some items you need, aside from the laptop. MOFT’s interior has convenient, expandable storage for this very reason. The bag is all you need to keep essentials such as power adapters, notebooks, cell phones, mouses, etc.

 

It’s almost magic how MOFT can keep expanding to offer the room you need without adding bulk - thanks to the neoprene material that shapes it to any carry-on essentials.

The innovative fold-in triangle structure makes it sturdy and stable enough to prop up your device. It can support up to 10 kg and fits all laptops on the market.

MOFT Carry Sleeve is made with customized PU material and fiberglass, making it slim, lightweight and durable while looking superb. You can carry your laptop in a sleek style, without the bulk. 

 It gives you a feather-soft touch feeling just like real leather with a sense of technology. Folding endurance keeps it in shape even it’s folded a thousand times.

MOFT carry sleeve is made by 100% vegan PU leather material. It's eco-friendly and more sustainable than animal leather. Plus, the animal leather is not water-resistant. It absorbs water and gets quite wet.

A

 

Lately we got much feedback that some of our users wanted to have one for iPad as well. We hear you! We successfully upgrade the carry sleeve to another version which will suit iPad just fine. 
There are two sizes for iPad Pro 11 and iPad Pro 12.9” respectively. Its flexible storage enables you to carry all your necessities such as keyboards (including Magic Keyboard), Apple Pencil, etc. 

More Adjustable Angles

When your iPad is taken out for work or a recreation, the sleeve can also be converted into a stand, ramping up your comfort and productivity with four adjustable angles.

15°/25°/45°/60° In Landscape

15°/25° In Portrait

Designed with more angles. MOFT iPad sleeve is going to fill all your needs, like hand-writing, web-browsing and watching videos whenever you’re on the road.

 

MOFT stands for “Mobile Office for Travelers”. A collective focused on creating innovations that boost productivity from a variety of angles.  

As a multinational team with people aged from 23 to 35, we are on our computers at least eight hours a day, often on our laptops in a mobile state - from airplanes to rail, from cafes to parks, anywhere and everywhere.

When it comes to mobile working, there are three things on the top of our essentials list: A mobile device for productivity, like laptop or iPad. A Sleeve to carry and protect devices, a lightweight and foldable stand for comfortable working. 

As a team who value high efficiency and minimalist. We hope people could carry less stuff but still stay productive at work. That's also the reason we put effort in combining a laptop stand into a slim and lightweight sleeve. People can therefore take only a laptop sleeve for a short commute.

Here is what we did to get it off the ground. We start to develop the shape and structure of the sleeve with inspiration from document bags and paper envelopes. We keep it as simple as possible in the shape of one piece via according bag-sealing method. Meanwhile, we want to make it capable of what papers can’t achieve - scratch resistance, water resistance, shock resistance, stand, and expandable storage, so it can also store computer and office accessories including papers, pens, phones, convertors, adapters and more. Therefore, the sleeve can be the only needed carry-on bag.

 

There are plentiful solutions we had tried to combine laptop stand into a sleeve, but they were all given up because they are either too bulky or too heavy. Until last year, we found a high-molecular material that is extremely slim, scratch-resistant and durable. It’s the perfect material to work with the elastic yet deformation-resistant neoprene. After integrating these hard and soft materials by using collage in the design process, we get a very interesting and special mixture of elastic space and strong structure for a laptop stand sleeve. Eventually, we went through several rounds of designs to make it work to our satisfaction. 

This is it. It’s MOFT Carry Sleeve that we bring to IndieGoGo to share with everyone. We hope to have the support from you here if our sleeve seems to be the right one you have been looking for.

 

 

Shipping and Return Policy

Shipping Policy

We plan to ship the first batch of perks in late August. We're happy to offer worldwide shipping (except in Brazil, due to its current issue with undelivered items). The shipping rate for your country will be indicated in the check-out menu once you make a pledge for this campaign. Please note that the price of the item does not include additional duty and taxes that may apply, as per local importation laws.

Return Policy

Indiegogo is a platform that allows innovators to offer their creations and ideas at discounted prices. These funds go towards initiating the production and launching of the product, resulting in a product the backer can use and enjoy. In accordance with Indiegogo Terms of Use we will not offer refunds or return for items that are not defective. However, in the event that you receive a faulty item, you are welcome to contact us at cs@moft.us

It adheres to the MOFT’s design philosophy ”Good product is invisible” It’s a wise carry-on solution for short-distance commuting. From the office to the cafe to school, MOFT keeps your day-to-day adventures light and convenient.  Designed by exclusive structure, the MOFT Carry Sleeve can be folded up to a stand in literally one second. With your laptop screen raised to a higher level, you will naturally sit straighter and negate physical stress. With MOFT carry sleeve, you don’t need to carry an extra laptop stand around with you - it’s already there, making your work life healthier without anything extra.We designed MOFT sleeve to have two angles -  15° and 25°. Now, browsing through files and documents or having online meetings will be much more comfortable when your laptop is placed on the stand in 25° angles, which is the highest angles among the sleeves. And if you work at a higher desk? The 15° is ideal for an improved, strain-free view. We all know that there are always some items you need, aside from the laptop. MOFT’s interior has convenient, expandable storage for this very reason. The bag is all you need to keep essentials such as power adapters, notebooks, cell phones, mouses, etc. It’s almost magic how MOFT can keep expanding to offer the room you need without adding bulk - thanks to the neoprene material that shapes it to any carry-on essentials.The innovative fold-in triangle structure makes it sturdy and stable enough to prop up your device. It can support up to 10 kg and fits all laptops on the market.MOFT Carry Sleeve is made with customized PU material and fiberglass, making it slim, lightweight and durable while looking superb. You can carry your laptop in a sleek style, without the bulk.  It gives you a feather-soft touch feeling just like real leather with a sense of technology. Folding endurance keeps it in shape even it’s folded a thousand times.MOFT carry sleeve is made by 100% vegan PU leather material. It's eco-friendly and more sustainable than animal leather. Plus, the animal leather is not water-resistant. It absorbs water and gets quite wet.A Lately we got much feedback that some of our users wanted to have one for iPad as well. We hear you! We successfully upgrade the carry sleeve to another version which will suit iPad just fine. There are two sizes for iPad Pro 11 and iPad Pro 12.9” respectively. Its flexible storage enables you to carry all your necessities such as keyboards (including Magic Keyboard), Apple Pencil, etc. More Adjustable AnglesWhen your iPad is taken out for work or a recreation, the sleeve can also be converted into a stand, ramping up your comfort and productivity with four adjustable angles.15°/25°/45°/60° In Landscape15°/25° In PortraitDesigned with more angles. MOFT iPad sleeve is going to fill all your needs, like hand-writing, web-browsing and watching videos whenever you’re on the road. MOFT stands for “Mobile Office for Travelers”. A collective focused on creating innovations that boost productivity from a variety of angles.  As a multinational team with people aged from 23 to 35, we are on our computers at least eight hours a day, often on our laptops in a mobile state - from airplanes to rail, from cafes to parks, anywhere and everywhere.When it comes to mobile working, there are three things on the top of our essentials list: A mobile device for productivity, like laptop or iPad. A Sleeve to carry and protect devices, a lightweight and foldable stand for comfortable working. As a team who value high efficiency and minimalist. We hope people could carry less stuff but still stay productive at work. That's also the reason we put effort in combining a laptop stand into a slim and lightweight sleeve. People can therefore take only a laptop sleeve for a short commute.Here is what we did to get it off the ground. We start to develop the shape and structure of the sleeve with inspiration from document bags and paper envelopes. We keep it as simple as possible in the shape of one piece via according bag-sealing method. Meanwhile, we want to make it capable of what papers can’t achieve - scratch resistance, water resistance, shock resistance, stand, and expandable storage, so it can also store computer and office accessories including papers, pens, phones, convertors, adapters and more. Therefore, the sleeve can be the only needed carry-on bag. There are plentiful solutions we had tried to combine laptop stand into a sleeve, but they were all given up because they are either too bulky or too heavy. Until last year, we found a high-molecular material that is extremely slim, scratch-resistant and durable. It’s the perfect material to work with the elastic yet deformation-resistant neoprene. After integrating these hard and soft materials by using collage in the design process, we get a very interesting and special mixture of elastic space and strong structure for a laptop stand sleeve. Eventually, we went through several rounds of designs to make it work to our satisfaction. This is it. It’s MOFT Carry Sleeve that we bring to IndieGoGo to share with everyone. We hope to have the support from you here if our sleeve seems to be the right one you have been looking for.  Shipping and Return PolicyShipping PolicyWe plan to ship the first batch of perks in late August. We're happy to offer worldwide shipping (except in Brazil, due to its current issue with undelivered items). The shipping rate for your country will be indicated in the check-out menu once you make a pledge for this campaign. Please note that the price of the item does not include additional duty and taxes that may apply, as per local importation laws.Return PolicyIndiegogo is a platform that allows innovators to offer their creations and ideas at discounted prices. These funds go towards initiating the production and launching of the product, resulting in a product the backer can use and enjoy. In accordance with Indiegogo Terms of Use we will not offer refunds or return for items that are not defective. However, in the event that you receive a faulty item, you are welcome to contact us at cs@moft.us

story:
Developer Information:


American developer, Eric Gyamfi, is a 15 year old tech enthusiast. He was born in Washington, DC but has been raised in Maryland and currently lives in Frederick, Maryland with his twin sister and parent. Mr. Gyamfi considers himself tech savvy and knows more about technology than the average person. He spends most of his time on some type of electronic device and plans to go to a Technical Institute after he graduates from high school.

He came up with the idea when he was with his mother (who loves garage sales) and they passed a garage sale sign. He said to his mother, “Wouldn’t be cool if there was an app to show you where all the garage sales are in the area?!?!” So, he has joined forces with Zapporoo to transform his idea into a marketable platform. Mr. Gyamfi is very passionate about his app and believes it will positively impact everyone who uses it.


How Does it Work?

Mr. Gyamfi has been creating and documenting this concept for quite some time. He has several “mock-up” drawings of this app, which have provided the developer with a sense of how the concept will appear once brought into production.  This is beneficial for making any necessary modifications and revisions for improvements; thus promoting a more satisfactory and overall accommodating app. The app has unique features not presently available in the marketplace.  Although the programming has not yet been developed and is still in the developmental stages, an explanation of possible operation is as follows: The primary function of the app is to help users find yard and garage sales that are in close proximity. The users having the sales will be able to type in information about their sale and post pictures of what is going to be in the sale.

W-sale is a must for anyone looking to buy or sell items.


What Problem(s) Does it Solve?

The unique features of this app will provide the following benefits for all consumers:
• Helps find yard and garage sale close to them 
• Gives mass exposure to users having sales
• Users can post descriptions of their sale and post pictures of items that are for sale


Marketing

Mr. Gyamfi envisions his app appealing to multitudes of consumers who use their “electronic devices” not only for communication but also for innovative solutions. The markets are extensive for an ingenious app like W-Sale; Google Play and iTunes are the most popular app stores in the primary market and are the ideal places to market this app. However, for the Android version of the app there are several new stores popping all over the cyber world such as, AppsLib, Samsung Apps, F-Droid, Slide ME, GetJar, and Amazon App Store for Android. Mr. Gyamfi wishes to leave the market open for subsequent variances and possibilities that could improve the feasibility and marketability of his product.

story:
Objects Matter

BA Product Design



About us

We are Central Saint Martin's Product Design graduates of 2015. Months of hard work have gone into the making of our final year products and we can't wait to share them with the world this June in London.

This year, we will be exhibiting products that tackle challenges in industry from health care to politics, and we hope that in the course of our degree show we will be able to convince many visitors of our visions and designs.

Why are we asking for donations? 

The degree show will be the first opportunity for most of us to showcase and present ourselves to the public. Therefore it is a crucial milestone on our journeys to become Product Designers, and will hopefully be a starting point for our professional careers. 


We are willing to go the extra mile to make this year's show the best Central Saint Martin has ever seen, however, unfortunately great ideas and ambitious plans alone, aren't enough - they also need to be financed.

Our campaign is aiming at current and former CSM students, friends and families, as well as professionals and corporations related to the college. 

For donations we are offering a range of perks. For details please refer to the individual explanations on this website.


What will your money be used for?

By contributing to the fund raising campaign for our Degree Show you will help us to convey our wide range of design concepts to potential employers and the public. 

To allow visitors a better overview we will produce an illustrated Degree Show Catalogue, featuring everyone's work and the underlying processes. 

In order to make the most the dedicated space we would like to invest in new exhibition stands, allowing us to present both, our self-initatied and our client projects, in the most appropriate way.

Last but not least, an active promotion of our Degree Show to the press, the public and interested corporations will help to foster our personal careers and at the same time will have a positive impact on the perception of the BA Product Design Course at Central Saint Martins. This way, also future generations of CSM students will benefit from a success of our Degree Show.


Other ways to help us. 

Please spread the word of our campaign!

Any support in kind (materials, printing, equipment, press coverage, food and beverages) is highly appreciated.

For questions, assistance with the donation process and/or personal contact to our organisation team please refer to the following e-mail address:

bapd.organisation@gmail.com

story:
“This campaign is truly a steal! As an amateur online filmmaker, I didn’t have the budget to truly go to school or invest in expensive filmmaking software, so when I saw Lis’ app I was hooked! I am not a professional video producer or actor by any measure which is why the filmmaking course was so appealing. I cannot wait to see this program come to life because it will be a total game changer. For the small donation of $100 I was able to help this mobile application come to market, get a film school certification, and enter for a chance to win $1000! Who doesn’t love that combination!?”
Tracy Freese, Director of Operations, Home of Wealth LLC

Launch Your Story. 

                   StoryBoard + Edit                          Composite + Publish

VERSION 1.0:

The KEY operative words are:

 "ease-of-use, pro-features, nearly zero learning-curve and low-cost per seat" 

and highly-intuitive innovative and different controls and workflow. I'll let grandma test it just to be sure I'm delivering on this promise ;-)

VERY EASY FOR NEWBIES. 
100% PRO FEATURES INCLUDED!

Features and the ultimate sophisticated look that you want and need are all there. But over 600+ innovative under-the-hood innovations that'll keep your workflow simple, elegant and powerful. 

Psst! 

A few juicy EXTREMELY-DELICIOUS FEATURES we'll keep for our dear supporters for the beta stage, one week prior to appstores' release. This will be a complete surprise features that will blow your mind. I promise you this!

"Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication." Steve Jobs (quoting L. Da Vinci)

Let my app make it MORE BEAUTIFUL and easier for YOU!

iWatch integration in Version 2.0, MAY 2015!!!

+My app will allow you to use any of your stored pics and videos from any system: 

  • dropbox, local Mac or PC, iPhone, iPad, Galaxy, etc. or take live shots and integrate VERY FAST into a professional standard film storyboard or a FINAL film if you so desire, 
  • with sound SFX, panned-audio, imaging effects, camera pans, tracking, zoom and dolly. 
  • Also, there will be editable duration-setting on each panel/image, editable shot numbering, canned character cutouts, multi-plane-multi-degrees cutout rotations, custom cutout import and 
  • compose individual panels to pages, then pages to scenes and 
  • finally fill and composite the scenes to a fully-made film, cinema or video you can make go viral!. 

I've already designed and readied 3 iWatch apps in preparation for the release of this app!

+You can edit and watch/play:

  • a single panel (or image), 
  • single page (of multiple panels), 
  • single scene (of multiple pages),
  • single sequence (of multiple scenes) or 
  • choose any number to play in sequence or all of them at any point in your development.
  • Save as film. Volia! Your Masterpiece!

+You can edit and arrange by: 

  • drag-drop, zoom, pinch or swipe any single element as you are viewing them!
  •  Then directly export .mov or .mp4 film to Dropbox, YouTube, Vimeo, your blog, CNN etc. or 
  • integrate tightly to your script-writing drafts. 
  • It's up to you how you use it to composite your film storyboards and develop your masterpieces!

+Security and privacy of data on your devices will be ensured through: 

  • 2-step verification and 
  • a standard platform-appropriate encrypted PIN-lock access

+Easiest system you'll ever use. I designed it for my own use after lots of frustrating trials and hard-core frustrations with many other storyboarding systems!

+There will be NO ADS because this is a paid app on all systems. We may put ads to offer up FREE and deeply-discounted content from our own development, making your creative juices flow even deeper, brighter and create masterpieces to be proud of! Be proud of yourself. 

+...PLUS MANY MORE features slated for Version 1.0 (600+ under-the-hood that I can't even mention here because I don't want to bore you with technical jargon!)

You DO indeed know how to create film storyboards and final films!.............

...............Let my LK StoryBoarder make it EVEN BETTER for you!

+Available through apps downloadable on platforms starting with: 

  • version 1.0 for iPhone, iPad, Android Lollipop, Amazon Kindle (all flavors), MacOSX, PC, Linux, WebGL and Web HTML5. 
  • Version 2.0 will expand apps offerings on many more platforms.
  • The versioning will be iterative, often with bug fixes and features additions.
  • Currently, I code and write full-time and nothing will distract me from my support activities for my project.

+Current price will be: 

  • My hot price will be $4.99 on each mobiles OS (iPhone, iPad, Galaxy, Kindle, etc) and $9.99 on desktop (PC, Mac, Linux, etc) and web. 
  • Comparable products currently in the marketplace are super-buggy, zero-support and around $25+ a pop on mobiles (ouch!) and $49+ on desktops (minimum price - triple ouch...that hurts!)  with very few features and heavy restrictions of all types on data-file saving, conversion to PDFs, .mov or .mp4...... 

I AIM TO CHANGE THAT FOREVER! 

+In-app-purchasing will be offered: 

  • for even more beautiful artwork, music, pics that we'll license with highly-innovative partners at the best market deals possible for all end-users
  • to allow your final film storyboards or films ready for publication to be masterpieces you will be proud of!

"Success is 1% talent and 99% hard work." 

Albert Einstein

+I will use the pledged funds for: 

  • licensing for more artwork to let you storyboard with, 
  • backend cloud-data-systems connectivity to AWS EC2 systems like Dropbox, 
  • then bullet-proof security testing it through more beta testing, 
  • deliver beautiful rewards to all supporters at all support levels and 
  • do lots of promotion so that version 2.0 onward, can be a success right after this version 1.0. 
  • Version 1.0 will be delivered 60 days or earlier after Indiegogo funding is secured. I'm exclusive with Indiegogo campaigns!
  • Ver. 1.0 will be a fully-tested and bugs-free release with targeted features as listed in this campaign. More features will be added in iterative increments as it is done in any well-crafted and tightly-managed Agile SCRUM-compliant project such as this.
  • Guaranteed support with a maximum response window of 3 hours max. Writing, coding, project management and support is what I do, every day, all-year long. I work hard. No buts, ifs or excuses! Always play it like you mean it.
  • Development progress page will be "live" webpage available to all supporters at all levels with SCRUM project-scheduled work-items burndown chart with advanced dashboarded-info (Please see UPDATES! section info for more).
  • BTW: I work with a FULL team of over 250 developers, composers, coders, artists and writers worldwide. We share, barter and distribute our Creative Commons art worldwide. This keeps my development costs to absolute bare-minimum while still allowing me to produce the BEST-QUALITY products at breakneck speeds!
  • Also....BTW: iWatch version in Version 2.0, May 2015!

  • 100% Integrated with the LK StoryBoarder App!

  • (NOTE: normal value up to $897 retail, available for pledges of $50+!)

  • 20+ lectures and nearly 4 hours of content!
  • By the end of the course you will be able to shoot any video correctly and 
  • learn how to tell a story with visuals and sound and 
  • use the LK Storyboarder App system even better and become a better master at your own game across all of your devices, genres and sets!
  • This video is especially tailored towards newbies and making you an intermediate FILMMAKER in your own right! What you do after this will be the unleashing of your inner arts child and completely up to you!
  • Offered at a SPECIAL PRICE OF $115 ONLY if you buy separately later for all supporters starting in June 2015.

PRESS RELEASES


Me and My Work:

LisasGAMEAPPs.com (RADIO PROMO HERE: LISTEN NOW)

My LINKEDIN: 

http://lisakristinardottir.strikingly.com/

My VIMEO (all video updates): 

https://vimeo.com/user22341923/videos

My PROJECT TECHNICAL UPDATES POSTED HERE:  ScrumDesk Project Login

story:
Short Summary

Hi Karen Reid CEO of The Flexie Bench.

As a freelancer and an owner of several small businesses over the years, I have often felt frustrated at not being able to secure as many large contracts as I know that my team and I could deliver.  Sometimes I had been let down by contacts who said they would be available and then, in the middle of preparing a response to a bid, that same contact suddenly takes on a new contract leaving me in a pickle!

Not so long ago, while leading a large change programme at an engineering company of circa 30,000 employees, it felt like a never ending challenge trying to get credible resources at short notice, and it was then that the idea hit me!

There are more than enough opportunities for freelancers and small businesses we just need an enabling mechanism to enable us to find each other.  The rest is history so to speak!

Our concept for The Flexie Bench is designed to empower growing companies, to scale their workforce when needed, and to be confident about the integrity and skills of the members of their teams. Think about a bench of skills that is available on demand and can be rotated in and out of projects, as and when required, but without the usually associated overheads, and you'll get the idea!

We are an online resource providing a link between contractors (freelancers etc.) and companies and the ability for individuals and small teams to join forces to provide specific skills in a specific timeframe.

 

We envisioned a virtual global community working together to build and strengthen each other's companies, so that everyone can grow. SMEs account for over 95% of businesses, 60%-70% of employment and we generate a large share of new jobs.  Our size and agility makes us strong, but we have other challenges that make it difficult for us to compete – and this is where The Flexie Bench comes in.  We will help growing prospects to:

find and secure contracts with larger organisations

join up to create a virtual team to bid and win larger contracts

build confidence and skill to go up against a larger competitors

 

What We Need & What You Get

#1 We have the best Customer experience gurus on board and ready to start working with our prospects.  

#2 We have developed our platform, to allow us to make a credible quick start. 

#3 We know that being able to access stuff on our phones with ease and speed is essential in today’s world and the next step would be for our platform to be available via a mobile friendly app. 

#4 We need to ensure the first group of users are referenced checked to make a great 1st impression and keep to our promise of credible resources.

We want to ensure that we can get this valuable resource to the right people quickly and we are keeping in real about the help we now need to get this all done.  In line with our concept we are reaching out especially to small businesses & freelancers to develop and launch this remarkable service.

We now need to raise £33k to help with operating costs and to launch into the market and this is how that number is broken down.  

#5  £20k would be used for Customer Happiness (global) support in 3 time zones, for 6 months

#6  £3k would be used for Outsourced Referencing of contractors

#7  £4k would be used for mobile App development.

#8  £6k would be used for Marketing the service to freelancers and new businesses

So what are we offering in exchange for your support?  

We’ve received some generous donations from team members and friends and it’s my pleasure to offer this wonderful mix of rewards to say a big thank you for any financial support you are able to offer. 

On our Rewards list, we have:

Gift vouchers of 3 months’ free service on The FlexieBench for yourself, family, friend with a business.

Meet and Greet with The FlexieBench team at our launch party, with lots of surprise treats.

VIP experience at The FlexieBench Launch Party – welcome glass of bubbly and canapes, photos with the team and an exclusive chat with founder Karen Reid

1-day of Change Manager training for a team of up to 8 people – with a value of £2,900

½-day of individual 1-2-1 Communication training – with a value of £1,000

½-day of individual 1-2-1 coaching for the 'Accidental Change Agent' from a well-known change practitioner, author and coach – with a value of £1,800

Dine and review a restaurant with Citylicious (www.citylicious.net) – one of the largest reviewing platforms in the UK, bringing the world of food and drink to your fingertips

Personal Training Sessions by our friends at Team 4 Fitness  – renowned for first class personal training in London (https://twitter.com/team4fitness)

Bespoke Jewellery by Sparklisation (https://www.facebook.com/pg/sparklisation/about/)

A chance to be interviewed by Selectress Dawn G, on Roots FM95.4 (https://soundcloud.com/user114782701)(http://ukrootsfm.radio.net)

 

The Impact

We know that competition is a natural part of life as a small business. We know that we can move faster, we can build deeper relationships with our customers.  However, it can still be daunting to go head to head with larger organisations – their brand, their economies of scale, pricing models, resources etc..  So how do we compete?

Freelancers and SMEs join The Flexie Bench!  The Flexie Bench is now the secret weapon that will enable start-ups, small and medium-sized enterprises and individuals access markets, boost their competitiveness and grow. We’ve used each failed bid and lost opportunity to analyse our larger competitors and carve out our own unique space in a crowded marketplace. 

 

Risks & Challenges


We’ve learned how to analyse our larger competitors to find out possible weak points. We’ve seen a strategy we can use to compete successfully by creating our own unique space in a crowded marketplace. We’’ve seen some examples of small businesses competing successfully with larger companies, using strategies like speed, differentiation, and clever use of social media. 
Coming up against a large competitor can be very intimidating, but with the strategies, resources we are putting into place, our clients will be equipped to put up a strong fight. Remind yourself of the story of David and Goliath – there was only one winner and it wasn’t the giant!  The FlexieBench is rooting for David.  We are here to enable SMEs to compete and win those lucrative opportunities. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help comes in so many formats and a little goes a very long way for us.  As Maya Angelou said I’ve learned that people will forget what you said. They will forget what you did. But they will never forget how you made them feel.  Even if you can’t contribute financially, just make me smile by sharing this with your network.  Please share our link so we can start to build our user database. (http://flexiebench.xyz/landingpage/)

You could be the reason why your friend, mum, dad, brother, cousin or sister might be the next success story.   With The Flexie Bench, we all grow, and everybody wins. What's so exciting about this project is how many people we could help.  Advanced thanks for all that you are able to do.

All the best,

Karen

story:
The above book trailer video is for the novel GateKEEPERS I coauthored with a retired University of Michigan Professor – based on a true story mine, about my first major challenge to the architectural profession’s resistance to the changes demanded by the real estate industry.  A management change, I hope to help bring to the architectural profession.  Please read on to learn more about my story.

As reported in the UK Parliament website (http://www.parliament.uk/about/living-heritage/...), “In October 1943, following the destruction of the Commons Chamber by incendiary bombs during the Blitz, the Commons debated the question of rebuilding the chamber. With Winston Churchill's approval, they agreed to retain its adversarial rectangular pattern instead changing to a semi-circular or horse-shoe design favoured by some legislative assemblies. Churchill insisted that the shape of the old Chamber was responsible for the two-party system which is the essence of British parliamentary democracy: (Winston Churchill's famous quotation) 'we shape our buildings and afterwards our buildings shape us.'”

Innovations have been some of the strongest building blocks of our great nation and the planning and design of our buildings will significantly influence innovations in our future.  It is important to point out and to consider that the design of our buildings and the management process by which they occur are significantly influenced by the managerial and communication skills of the architectural design teams involved.  Unfortunately, even today the architectural education system is significantly deficient in training student architects about necessary and proven business theories and principals required for architects to perform their responsibilities more effectively – and this deficiency carries into the profession of architecture.  This is a big part of the reason architects have lost significant managerial responsibilities during the past few decades to design/build firms, property management companies, and facility managers.

My objective is to help bring about a change that is required in our very competitive international business world that would enhance university and business knowledge and understanding of the many benefits (user increased production and building construction and operating cost savings) that are derived from a building design process that employs proven management principals and participative management concepts.  In my case, the education, research and development costs are completed and paid for.  I have applied the concepts discussed in this Indiegogo campaign throughout my professional career.  These concepts were applied in 2002 when I had coauthored the Site Selection Guide for the U.S. General Services Administration first used for new federal courthouses and later to my understanding for most other federal property site acquisitions and expanded in my paper presented at the United Nations endorsed International Council for Research and Innovation in Building and Construction (CIB) W70 2004 Hong Kong Symposium.

I remain in excellent shape mentally and physically – have been in process of participating in Krav Maga (React Self Defense) classes the past five months (with a reported 30% police participation), belong to local YMCA, and remain very physically fit mentally.  My history described in this proposal demonstrates wisdom, endurance, and the tenacity to never give up.

The issue here is funding, and if this proposal is fully funded, I promise to focus the majority of the remainder of my career to help expand upon the public’s knowledge of the many benefits derived from an ongoing participative management process throughout the architectural design phases.  This will include actions to help and work with universities, the architectural profession, businesses, institutions, and government agencies to better plan and utilize their facilities based on more effective planning and communication.

PLAN AND OBJECTIVES

If this Indiegogo campaign is successful, since capital is needed my intent is to spend most of the remainder of my professional career focused on sharing my lifetime of knowledge and experience to help the architectural profession, businesses, institutions, and government agencies to better plan and utilize their facilities… through more comprehensive and formalized efforts to share information and to plan facilities based on both short- and long-term strategic objectives… with the objective to reduce construction and operating costs and increase productivity based on facilities designed more in tune with user needs.

During the first phase, I plan to contact and attempt to collaborate with the Arizona State University School of Design and W. P. Carey School of Business or the Frank Lloyd Wright School of Architecture – more likely Arizona State University because of their strong combined resources. A successful Indiegogo campaign will likely add relevance to my efforts to gain the cooperation of others needed to achieve a successful campaign; i.e., to contact and work with and for universities, the architectural profession, businesses, institutions, and government agencies.  I plan to contact Phoenix area businesses on an ongoing effort to provide them with information about the short- and long-term benefits of employing participative management concepts and principals from the early architectural design phases through construction and building operations.  In phase II, plan to take the program national to universities, business, and government agencies – with the hope to receive national publication interest.  I remain a licensed architect and my BSBA focused on marketing – was a marketing director with a national business architectural firm; and, was a marketing vice-president with two national real estate services companies – understand how and the benefits of effective marketing.  Also have an MBA (organization behavior) and a Master of Architecture.

If only partial funding is received, I would take actions to utilize funds to help address the issues mentioned in this proposal; i.e., contact local schools of architecture to try to encourage them to address required business education issues needed within their programs.  In any case, this is a process issue that would likely take years to accomplish, and with the cost of higher education today, it might take a generation or two for young people with similar education and experience that I have accomplished to occur.

In early 2002 I prepared a facility management membership survey for the then Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) affiliated International Society of Facilities Executives (ISFE), distributed by the ISFE to their entire membership for my analysis and presentation at their national symposium. Sadly, the 9/11 attacks occurred that led to the ISFE to cancel their national symposium. However, because of the survey’s success and the significance of the data and its analysis the ISFE decided to print a special edition (May 2002) of its monthly newsletter titled “Membership Survey Results.” The survey presented a number of organizational trends concerning in-house and outsourced real estate management.

The ISFE newsletter publication led to the lead editorial in Buildings magazine in October 2002 titled “The Complexities of Communications” – (based on my research and data analysis completed for the ISFE).

The ISFE and Buildings publications led to my invitation to write and present a paper for the CIB W70 2004 Hong Kong Symposium “The Human Elements of Facilities Management – Understanding the needs of the customers.” My paper was titled “The Organization Behavior Component of Facilities Management – Becoming Part of the Business Process.” The paper, in addition to other republications continues to be included on the Fraunhofer IRB website. Fraunhofer IRB is Germany’s central facility for national and international knowledge transfer in planning and building. The Fraunhofer IRB website states that they include papers “mainly from German speaking countries.” Therefore, as an American, I took this as an honor. It was and remains important to me to share knowledge to help society.

Please find a copy my CIB W70 paper and other relevant documents related to this campaign attached in this campaign's image gallery.  The campaign card image photograph shown on the bus included the CIB W70 Board members – I was invited to attend after my presentation.

HISTORY

Early during my architectural career while I was enrolled in the Ohio State University School of Architecture to earn my last degree, a Master of Architecture, I learned that opposition to change and new ideas remained strong. During the previous seven years I had earned three previous university degrees – two from Ohio State, B.S. degrees in architecture and Business Administration, and an MBA from Case Western Reserve University. During that previous seven year timeframe I had also worked summers and full- and part-time for architectural firms.

During the summer of 1974, a few weeks before I earned my MBA, I met with the then Chairman of the Ohio State School of Architecture to discuss possible enrollment in the 1974 fall quarter Master of Architecture program. The meeting was positive and included an agreement for about 40 hours of elective transfer credit from my MBA program; and, I presented a 15 hour credit independent study proposal – to share my combined business school and architectural knowledge with the local architectural community in the form of a survey to be distributed to all Columbus, Ohio area architectural firms by my personal interviews. The study’s analyzed results were intended to be shared with the local and national architectural communities. My intent was to synthesize my architectural education with the business education that focused on marketing (undergraduate) and organization behavior (MBA).

The Chairman was enthused about the idea and suggested two School of Architecture advisors to both share in the study – one was their most tenured professor and the other an adjunct professor who was also the president of the Architects Society of Ohio (ASO) – the state component of the American Institute of Architects (AIA). I agreed to accept and meet with both architecture professors and requested one additional advisor – a nationally recognized marketing professor in the Ohio State College of Administrative Science who was my undergraduate professor. All three professors had agreed and I enrolled in the Master of Architecture program.

During the fall quarter of 1974 and the winter quarter of 1975 I had developed the survey and met with several area architectural firms to test and enhance the survey based on their inputs. The School of Architecture even gave me my own office and some secretarial support. The survey focused on the marketing of architectural services and the organizational component of shared information to achieve business goals.

All was going great, the School of Architecture and I prepared an internal funding application request for review by the Ohio State University administration – documents were completed ready for my advisor signatures. During my funding discussions with the School of Architecture it was recommended that I attempt to meet with leadership from the Cleveland and national AIA offices. I contacted the Cleveland chapter AIA president and the Washington, D.C. AIA Executive Vice-President. We met at Nightgown restaurant located near the top of Cedar Hill in Cleveland Heights, Ohio. About a week later I received a letter from the national AIA Executive Vice-President that stated the AIA would not fund my study… a few days later the Chairman of the School of Architecture called me into his office to inform that my independent study would be stopped, but he gave me a 5-hour credit with an ‘A’ for work completed. The internal funding request had just been signed by my three advisors and the Chairman, but was not yet submitted to the university administration for its review and approval. In my opinion the AIA did not want the marketing know-how information promulgated to the architectural community.

I did not protest – I was a graduate student who wanted to earn his degree. During the fall quarter of 1975, my last before I had earned my Master of Architecture, one of my stopped independent study advisors had become ill – the president of the ASO. The Chairman of the School of Architecture asked if I would alone without supervision take over his graduate level Professional Practice course. I agreed and completed the course that had included my review and to determine grades of the graduate students mid-terms and final papers.

I had to submit grades for all of my graduate students the week after I had received my Master of Architecture degree. I had cleaned out my Columbus apartment and moved all of my personal belongings back to Cleveland. I returned the night before I had to turn in grades and got a room at the Ohio Stater hotel. About 3:00 a.m. a tall thin man in a ski mask broke into my first floor room through a window. He woke me when he stepped on the bed to steady himself as he had entered. I knew how to defend myself and attacked him… he stumbled out of the same window he had broken into. In the morning, I turned in the grades to the university and later in the day met for a scheduled meeting in the home of my former advisor who had been the president of the ASO.

I wound up working for one of the Cleveland architectural firms where I had been employed while I had earned my MBA. In December 1976 I sat for my Ohio and national architectural licensing exam. I did not pass one of the four parts of the national exam by two percentage points. During my follow-up research I found on file at the State Board of Examiners of Architects a recommendation from my former advisor who was then the previous president of the ASO – it said I was “Regarded as one of the top students overall to graduate from Ohio State University,” and “This man is highly qualified to be brilliant in the profession. The potential is all there.” I met with the State Board of Examiners board of directors – a very intimidating and humbling experience – was made to feel very small.

Again, I did not pass the exam the next year, but this time I had learned all of my exams drawn in my own hand had been destroyed by the State Board of Examiners of Architects in violation of Ohio statues. That’s when I hired an attorney to challenge – it had become clear that it had become a darned if you do and darned if you don’t situation. I didn’t want to walk away – too much knowledge to share with the profession and society.

I applied for a license without examination under the Ohio Revised Code (ORC) section 4703.08 part A. I had met all of the criteria, but the State Board of Examiners after a lengthy hearing where they were represented by an Assistant Attorney General said NO! The Board claimed that the statute I had applied under was a grandfather clause and not even one architect was licensed in Ohio under the statue. It was not! The actual grandfather clause expired in 1932 and the statue I had applied under was revised by the Ohio Legislature twice in the 1960s and another time in the 1970s. The Board worked with the Ohio Legislature to have ORC 4703.08 part A removed as an emergency measure. I fought that with the support of the Wisconsin and California architectural licensing boards. The day after the law was signed by the Governor, after a request by the then Ohio Senate President Pro-tem, the Secretary of the State Board of Examiners released a list of approximately 350 architects that had been licensed under ORC 4703.08 part A. Do you recall the movie “Tucker: The Man and His Dream?”

However, I realized early on that a battle of this magnitude would require multi-fronts to win. While my Ohio administrative and legal court battles progressed I had made contact with various national publications to try to take my battle public to become part of the public record. This led to a headline article titled “One Architect in Search of a License” for the National Center for the Study of Professions headquartered in Washington, D.C. – among others. This led to an invitation to speak on September 24, 1979 before the Subcommittee on Elementary, Secondary, and Vocational Education of the Committee on Education and Labor – United States House of Representatives – Ninety-Sixth Congress – Subcommittee on Elementary, Secondary, and Vocational Education and Labor, Washington. D.C. regarding: The Truth in Testing Act of 1979; and The Educational Testing Act of 1979.

A couple weeks before I had taken the national architect licensing exam for the last time in December, 1979, I met to discuss the upcoming national architect licensing exam with the then Director of the Ohio State University School of Architecture. The then Director, of Japanese descent, did not want to discuss the exam – instead, he told me about his life as a child when he and his teacher parents had been sent to a United States internment camp during World War II. He told me that he understood prejudice and that was the reason I was having trouble passing the exam. He stated that I should not worry and that for sure I would pass the exam on my next attempt – which I did with one of the higher national scores. Shortly after, I was invited to appear on the TV program 20/20, but I decided to pass in an attempt to move on.

Approximately two years later, the national architects licensing exam was removed and replaced and a more valid internship program had been established – to my understanding based on a consent decree with the Justice Department and/or the Federal Trade Commission.

In 2008 I released a novel named GateKEEPERS I coauthored with a retired University of Michigan professor that tells the story of my saga to earn my license to practice architecture. The website for the book can be found at www.domarbooks-gatekeepers.com It’s available at many locations online. The novel is NOT the intent of this Indiegogo funding request.

This is my last hurrah. Without the capital not sure how I might become positioned to effectively share my warehouse of knowledge. With the cost of college today, not sure how many generations it might take to find a person with a similar education and experiences that loves to share that knowledge with society. Without the funding, I intend to utilize my knowledge and experience to help people buy and sell homes.

Thank you,

Sheldon R. Stone, FARA, MBA

During the first phase, I plan to contact and attempt to collaborate with the Arizona State University School of Design and W. P. Carey School of Business or the Frank Lloyd Wright School of Architecture – more likely Arizona State University because of their strong combined resources. A successful Indiegogo campaign will likely add relevance to my efforts to gain the cooperation of others needed to achieve a successful campaign; i.e., to contact and work with and for universities, the architectural profession, businesses, institutions, and government agencies.  I plan to contact Phoenix area businesses on an ongoing effort to provide them with information about the short- and long-term benefits of employing participative management concepts and principals from the early architectural design phases through construction and building operations.  In phase II, plan to take the program national to universities, business, and government agencies – with the hope to receive national publication interest.  I remain a licensed architect and my BSBA focused on marketing – was a marketing director with a national business architectural firm; and, was a marketing vice-president with two national real estate services companies – understand how and the benefits of effective marketing.  Also have an MBA (organization behavior) and a Master of Architecture.
If only partial funding is received, I would take actions to utilize funds to help address the issues mentioned in this proposal; i.e., contact local schools of architecture to try to encourage them to address required business education issues needed within their programs.  In any case, this is a process issue that would likely take years to accomplish, and with the cost of higher education today, it might take a generation or two for young people with similar education and experience that I have accomplished to occur.
In early 2002 I prepared a facility management membership survey for the then Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) affiliated International Society of Facilities Executives (ISFE), distributed by the ISFE to their entire membership for my analysis and presentation at their national symposium. Sadly, the 9/11 attacks occurred that led to the ISFE to cancel their national symposium. However, because of the survey’s success and the significance of the data and its analysis the ISFE decided to print a special edition (May 2002) of its monthly newsletter titled “Membership Survey Results.” The survey presented a number of organizational trends concerning in-house and outsourced real estate management.
The ISFE newsletter publication led to the lead editorial in Buildings magazine in October 2002 titled “The Complexities of Communications” – (based on my research and data analysis completed for the ISFE).
The ISFE and Buildings publications led to my invitation to write and present a paper for the CIB W70 2004 Hong Kong Symposium “The Human Elements of Facilities Management – Understanding the needs of the customers.” My paper was titled “The Organization Behavior Component of Facilities Management – Becoming Part of the Business Process.” The paper, in addition to other republications continues to be included on the Fraunhofer IRB website. Fraunhofer IRB is Germany’s central facility for national and international knowledge transfer in planning and building. The Fraunhofer IRB website states that they include papers “mainly from German speaking countries.” Therefore, as an American, I took this as an honor. It was and remains important to me to share knowledge to help society.
Please find a copy my CIB W70 paper and other relevant documents related to this campaign attached in this campaign's image gallery.  The campaign card image photograph shown on the bus included the CIB W70 Board members – I was invited to attend after my presentation.
HISTORY
Early during my architectural career while I was enrolled in the Ohio State University School of Architecture to earn my last degree, a Master of Architecture, I learned that opposition to change and new ideas remained strong. During the previous seven years I had earned three previous university degrees – two from Ohio State, B.S. degrees in architecture and Business Administration, and an MBA from Case Western Reserve University. During that previous seven year timeframe I had also worked summers and full- and part-time for architectural firms.
During the summer of 1974, a few weeks before I earned my MBA, I met with the then Chairman of the Ohio State School of Architecture to discuss possible enrollment in the 1974 fall quarter Master of Architecture program. The meeting was positive and included an agreement for about 40 hours of elective transfer credit from my MBA program; and, I presented a 15 hour credit independent study proposal – to share my combined business school and architectural knowledge with the local architectural community in the form of a survey to be distributed to all Columbus, Ohio area architectural firms by my personal interviews. The study’s analyzed results were intended to be shared with the local and national architectural communities. My intent was to synthesize my architectural education with the business education that focused on marketing (undergraduate) and organization behavior (MBA).
The Chairman was enthused about the idea and suggested two School of Architecture advisors to both share in the study – one was their most tenured professor and the other an adjunct professor who was also the president of the Architects Society of Ohio (ASO) – the state component of the American Institute of Architects (AIA). I agreed to accept and meet with both architecture professors and requested one additional advisor – a nationally recognized marketing professor in the Ohio State College of Administrative Science who was my undergraduate professor. All three professors had agreed and I enrolled in the Master of Architecture program.
During the fall quarter of 1974 and the winter quarter of 1975 I had developed the survey and met with several area architectural firms to test and enhance the survey based on their inputs. The School of Architecture even gave me my own office and some secretarial support. The survey focused on the marketing of architectural services and the organizational component of shared information to achieve business goals.
All was going great, the School of Architecture and I prepared an internal funding application request for review by the Ohio State University administration – documents were completed ready for my advisor signatures. During my funding discussions with the School of Architecture it was recommended that I attempt to meet with leadership from the Cleveland and national AIA offices. I contacted the Cleveland chapter AIA president and the Washington, D.C. AIA Executive Vice-President. We met at Nightgown restaurant located near the top of Cedar Hill in Cleveland Heights, Ohio. About a week later I received a letter from the national AIA Executive Vice-President that stated the AIA would not fund my study… a few days later the Chairman of the School of Architecture called me into his office to inform that my independent study would be stopped, but he gave me a 5-hour credit with an ‘A’ for work completed. The internal funding request had just been signed by my three advisors and the Chairman, but was not yet submitted to the university administration for its review and approval. In my opinion the AIA did not want the marketing know-how information promulgated to the architectural community.
I did not protest – I was a graduate student who wanted to earn his degree. During the fall quarter of 1975, my last before I had earned my Master of Architecture, one of my stopped independent study advisors had become ill – the president of the ASO. The Chairman of the School of Architecture asked if I would alone without supervision take over his graduate level Professional Practice course. I agreed and completed the course that had included my review and to determine grades of the graduate students mid-terms and final papers.
I had to submit grades for all of my graduate students the week after I had received my Master of Architecture degree. I had cleaned out my Columbus apartment and moved all of my personal belongings back to Cleveland. I returned the night before I had to turn in grades and got a room at the Ohio Stater hotel. About 3:00 a.m. a tall thin man in a ski mask broke into my first floor room through a window. He woke me when he stepped on the bed to steady himself as he had entered. I knew how to defend myself and attacked him… he stumbled out of the same window he had broken into. In the morning, I turned in the grades to the university and later in the day met for a scheduled meeting in the home of my former advisor who had been the president of the ASO.
I wound up working for one of the Cleveland architectural firms where I had been employed while I had earned my MBA. In December 1976 I sat for my Ohio and national architectural licensing exam. I did not pass one of the four parts of the national exam by two percentage points. During my follow-up research I found on file at the State Board of Examiners of Architects a recommendation from my former advisor who was then the previous president of the ASO – it said I was “Regarded as one of the top students overall to graduate from Ohio State University,” and “This man is highly qualified to be brilliant in the profession. The potential is all there.” I met with the State Board of Examiners board of directors – a very intimidating and humbling experience – was made to feel very small.
Again, I did not pass the exam the next year, but this time I had learned all of my exams drawn in my own hand had been destroyed by the State Board of Examiners of Architects in violation of Ohio statues. That’s when I hired an attorney to challenge – it had become clear that it had become a darned if you do and darned if you don’t situation. I didn’t want to walk away – too much knowledge to share with the profession and society.
I applied for a license without examination under the Ohio Revised Code (ORC) section 4703.08 part A. I had met all of the criteria, but the State Board of Examiners after a lengthy hearing where they were represented by an Assistant Attorney General said NO! The Board claimed that the statute I had applied under was a grandfather clause and not even one architect was licensed in Ohio under the statue. It was not! The actual grandfather clause expired in 1932 and the statue I had applied under was revised by the Ohio Legislature twice in the 1960s and another time in the 1970s. The Board worked with the Ohio Legislature to have ORC 4703.08 part A removed as an emergency measure. I fought that with the support of the Wisconsin and California architectural licensing boards. The day after the law was signed by the Governor, after a request by the then Ohio Senate President Pro-tem, the Secretary of the State Board of Examiners released a list of approximately 350 architects that had been licensed under ORC 4703.08 part A. Do you recall the movie “Tucker: The Man and His Dream?”
However, I realized early on that a battle of this magnitude would require multi-fronts to win. While my Ohio administrative and legal court battles progressed I had made contact with various national publications to try to take my battle public to become part of the public record. This led to a headline article titled “One Architect in Search of a License” for the National Center for the Study of Professions headquartered in Washington, D.C. – among others. This led to an invitation to speak on September 24, 1979 before the Subcommittee on Elementary, Secondary, and Vocational Education of the Committee on Education and Labor – United States House of Representatives – Ninety-Sixth Congress – Subcommittee on Elementary, Secondary, and Vocational Education and Labor, Washington. D.C. regarding: The Truth in Testing Act of 1979; and The Educational Testing Act of 1979.
A couple weeks before I had taken the national architect licensing exam for the last time in December, 1979, I met to discuss the upcoming national architect licensing exam with the then Director of the Ohio State University School of Architecture. The then Director, of Japanese descent, did not want to discuss the exam – instead, he told me about his life as a child when he and his teacher parents had been sent to a United States internment camp during World War II. He told me that he understood prejudice and that was the reason I was having trouble passing the exam. He stated that I should not worry and that for sure I would pass the exam on my next attempt – which I did with one of the higher national scores. Shortly after, I was invited to appear on the TV program 20/20, but I decided to pass in an attempt to move on.
Approximately two years later, the national architects licensing exam was removed and replaced and a more valid internship program had been established – to my understanding based on a consent decree with the Justice Department and/or the Federal Trade Commission.
In 2008 I released a novel named GateKEEPERS I coauthored with a retired University of Michigan professor that tells the story of my saga to earn my license to practice architecture. The website for the book can be found at www.domarbooks-gatekeepers.com It’s available at many locations online. The novel is NOT the intent of this Indiegogo funding request.
This is my last hurrah. Without the capital not sure how I might become positioned to effectively share my warehouse of knowledge. With the cost of college today, not sure how many generations it might take to find a person with a similar education and experiences that loves to share that knowledge with society. Without the funding, I intend to utilize my knowledge and experience to help people buy and sell homes.
Thank you,
Sheldon R. Stone, FARA, MBA

story:
Weav

The interactive career and hiring support portal.

Weav solves the big problems created from the traditional recruitment industry's; outdated tools, lack of support, and obstructive business model

 

We do this by:

  • Creating new tools that always use interactive video technology to enable people and employers to connect holistically, showcasing who they are as well as what they've done.
  • Providing personal, dedicated support, and being inclusive. No matter the career or person every member has a dedicated careers support consultant, to help them dream big, create a strategy, and inspire confidence to take action. 
  • Enabling people and employers a route to avoid the middle man. 

 

The why:

Check out this video that shows why Weav is important... and why it's needed now more than ever...

 

The impact

 

Weav is designed to help you: 

Find your purpose:

Ignite your ambitions, find and define your dream! Then build a strategy with practical milestones to get there. 

Show the world you're one of a kind:

Build a career and personal brand profile (a Weav profile) to show the world who you are as well as what you've done. You're far more than text on a profile or paper! 

Discover your dream employer:

Search and compare employers anywhere in the world by reviewing their careers website and information inside the Weav portal - then, build a shortlist and be thoroughly ready to apply.
 
Apply, interview, and negotiate with a dedicated expert in your corner
 
Whether you're applying for a job or looking to level up in your current company- Weav is there to help you through each step with advice, coaching, and full outsourcing depending on your needs. 
 
Get promoted & keep building
 
Store and track your ongoing career success to ensure you're constantly progressing and building value into your career profile and personal brand. 
 
 

and for Employers:

Create the structure to hire a richer more diverse team 

Weav helps you integrate interactive video technology to enable you to show the people and culture of your employer brand as well as what you do. Then conversely it allows candidates to do the same, avoiding the limitation a CV-only review structure creates. 

Remove the middle man and hire more employees directly 

Your dedicated hiring support consultant is there first and foremost to help you hire directly by supplying the tools, strategy, and routes to success. They also provide support sessions and fully outsourced managed services should your situation require it. 

Increase efficiency and reduce the costs of recruitment 

Your hiring support consultant will also share knowledge and create tools to increase efficiencies across your whole recruitment process for the short, mid, and long term to reduce overall recruitment costs.

 

Why we're raising on Indegogo

Here's the break down:

Our target is to raise £40,000. This will help us grow our careers support team so we can help more people and offer more specialised support. We will also be able to expand our 'Discover Employers' section to uncover even more amazing employers that may otherwise fall through the traditional gaps. 

so... don't forget to:

  **CLICK BACK US AND/OR SELECT A PERK**

 

What you get:

Portal access 

The portal is free for anyone to join and become a Weav member. 

Support

Everyone gets support but the type depends on the type of membership - Free, Plus, Premium, and Employer.

Sessions

Support sessions range from coaching video calls to full outsourced takeovers so we get to do things on a member's behalf.

Managed services

If members want to clock off and allow us to take over parts of their recruitment process they have that option as well.

 

The abridged story so far...

Weav was founded in 2018. Over the past two years, Weav been on a mission to prove that using video has a real impact on individuals and employers in a highly competitive employment market. Happily, we've helped numerous employers and individuals use the power of video to level up and achieve their goals. 

So far it's been bootstrap funded by its founder Alex with all profits reinvested to improve the features and services of the Weav portal. As covid hit the global economy Weav was already developing a consumer support service that was quickly built into the portal to help everyone no matter their background. 

 

We'll always be real with you...

Weav is not a silver bullet. Like most tools, Weav cannot take responsibility for users finding a job and if the platform isn't used then it will not be effective. 

Sometimes things go wrong. As a start-up business using new and exciting technology and producing new features regularly, there may occasionally be a few teething problems. 

  • Don't worry, Weav... got this! As one of our key features is live chat - if you experience issues we'll be on hand to sort them in realtime. 

 

Other ways you can help!

We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out about Weav and make some noise about we can help them level up their career or hiring!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools, spread the good news!

story:
Why It Feels Like Facebook Is Listening Through Your Mic

 

Conspiracy theorists think Facebook has tapped your phone's microphone to target ads by listening to your conversations. Truth is, it doesn't have to. On video below WSJ's Joanna Stern explains how Facebook really keeps tabs on you.

 

 

What if there was a social network without ads ?

 

INTRODUCING
 

 

 A powerful communication tool that provides users with an infinite range of possibilities on the same platform.

 

Would you like to have your own radio station ?

 


JUST IMAGINE!

Create your own radio shows, have fun and also earn money with the help of sponsors and followers!

 

 

keep in touch with your friends

 

...even when you are not online

 

 

Turn all your likes to real-life benefits !

 

 

Genoma rewards is a rewards program, through which users can redeem their likes for real-life benefits. As in existent social networks, all user’s activity can be rated by the community with a like or a dislike. Each like gives the user, who published the information, a positive point and each dislike deducts a point. At the end of the day, the user can exchange all his points for coins of the rewards program.

 

 

To acquire a benefit, the beneficiary user must approach a sales point or a benefactor user to have his or her QR code scanned. At that moment, the system will transfer the amount of coins required to obtain the benefit from the beneficiary user’s account to the benefactor user's account.

Benefactor users, in addition to attracting more customers to their businesses, can use these coins within Genoma as a form of payment or to obtain discounts on advertisements, premium packages, highlighted posts, etc.

 

This way, we not only encourage users to share value, but also bring companies closer to their clients in a non-intrusive way.

 

COINS

  • Each is worth 100 likes.
  • Do not have expiration date
  • Cannot be bought with money
  • Are non-transferable
  • Can be exchanged for benefits of the rewards program, or excepted as a form of payment within the site for advertising services, highlighting publications, premium packages, etc (for payments within the site, in some cases it can cover up to 100% of the cost and in other cases up to a maximum percentage).

 

USER'S BALANCE

  • The user has three types of assets: Likes, Coins and Cash
  • The cash will not be affected by the ratings of the posts (if the user obtains only dislikes, this will not deduct money from the account in cash).
  • The minimum amount for likes and coins is zero.
  • If upon reaching zero likes and zero coins, the user continues to gain dislikes in his or her publications, this will not generate negative balances. As soon as the user starts receiving likes, he or she will start increasing the balance again.

  • If the user reaches zero likes and continues to gain dislikes in publications, given that he or she has coins in the balance, these coins start changing to likes to cover the negative balance. Each coin will become 100 likes again.

 

We return the control over the information to those it really belongs to: the users!

 

Nobody will generate deceptive content to get likes anymore, because users now have a powerful tool to express their displeasure. If somebody posts deceptive content, they will lose all their coins and will have to start from scratch.

 

 

 

INVESTMENT DETAILS

 

 

AWS prices details
 

These are virtual servers. The service's name is C4.8 xLarge service with Linux as Operative System. Each virtual server has 36 Cores and 60Gb of RAM.

  • Load Balancer (Frankfurt - Germany) : u$ 26.- per month.
  • Frontal #1 (Oregon - USA) : u$ 1178,93.- per month.
  • Frontal #2 (Sao Pablo - Brasil) : u$ 1830,27.- per month.
  • Frontal #3 (Frankfurt - Germany) : u$ 1346,40.- per month.
  • Frontal #4 (Singapore - Singapore) : u$ 1369,37.- per month.
  • Frontal #5 (Tokio - Japan) : u$ 1493,86.- per month. 

Total monthly investment: u$ 7.244,83.-
Total annual investment:  u$ 86.937,96.-

*Prices for a single server in each location, running 24/7 . If the server of any location reaches 80% of its maximum capacity of work, the system will automatically start a new server to balance the workload in that location. This will increase the costs of such location.

 

Own servers price details
